libshapedraw.shape

Class GLUShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • libshapedraw.shape.Shape
      • libshapedraw.shape.GLUShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XrayShape
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLUCylinder, GLUDisk, GLUPartialDisk, GLUSphere

    public abstract class GLUShape
extends Shape
implements XrayShape
    Intermediate base class for simple shapes rendered using GLU (OpenGL Utility Library).

    The default drawing style for GLU quadrics is GLU_FILL, which will result in flat unicolor polygons. To make the shape look more 3-dimensional, you can:

    • Change the drawing style to use wireframe lines or points, e.g. shape.getGLUQuadric().setDrawStyle(GLU.GLU_LINE); or
    • Apply a custom ShapeTransform to enable lighting prior to rendering the quadric.

      • isWireframe

        public boolean isWireframe()

      • setWireframe

        public GLUShape setWireframe(boolean wireframe)
        Convenience method to toggle between GLU_LINE and GLU_FILL for the quadric's draw style.

        To specify other draw styles use, e.g.: getGLUQuadric().setDrawStyle(GLU.GLU_SILHOUETTE).

      • setWireframe

        public GLUShape setWireframe(boolean wireframe,
                    float lineWidth)
